can you please also mention if the current openbmc points to mctp that has this supported in the commit message - that is needed to ensure that we dont break pldm for openbmc builds.
I added this patch set to topic mctp2.0. So it is base on mctp code v2.0

Hi Nguyễn,
Is it advisable to reinitialize terminus here?
https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/platform-mc/platform_manager.cpp#L16

Since it might also receive ```PLDM_NOT_READY``` ```PLDM_ERROR_NOT_READY``` from either ```GetPDR or Supported PLDM Type?

There is no info when the time out happens, So I would like to make the simple code.
When there is failure in initialize terminus, I think it is better to end the discovery flow with error. So the issue investigation steps can be executed.
Please note that this code is not armed to resolve the time out issue of the terminus. It is armed to handle the available state of terminus for sensor polling and event handling.
Acknowledged
